alert.note: Alert for City of Danville; Pittsylvania (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 1:20PM EST until January 11 at 2:20AM EST by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in North Carolina...Virginia... Dan River near Danville affecting Pittsylvania, Rockingham, Caswell and the City of Danville. Dan River at Paces affecting Halifax County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Virginia... Roanoke (Staunton) River At Brookneal affecting Charlotte, Halifax and Campbell Counties. Roanoke (Staunton) River at Randolph affecting Charlotte and Halifax Counties. Dan River at South Boston affecting Halifax County. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in Virginia...North Carolina... Pigg River Near Sandy Level affecting Pittsylvania County. Dan River Near Wentworth affecting Rockingham County. For the Roanoke River...including the Pigg River near Sandy Level, Brookneal, and Randolph...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Dan River...including Danville, Paces, and South Boston... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Dan River near STP near Danville. * WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 23.0 feet, Flooding begins to affect Riverside shopping center. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:45 PM EST Wednesday the stage was 22.1 feet. - Bankfull stage is 17.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 12:45 PM EST Wednesday was 22.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this afternoon and continue falling to 6.6 feet Monday morning. - Flood stage is 21.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 23.3 feet on 02/24/2019. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 230 PM EST.
